Dialogue: Like Ozzy.

Dialogue: You chop up the smart flatworm and feed it to the dumb one and presto, the dumb one suddenly knows the maze inside and out.

Dialogue: Just by absorbing the first worm into its cellular structure, it gets all of the worm's memories.

Dialogue: That's probably why Hannibal Lecter's so smart.

Dialogue: So what's the point?

Dialogue: Deal. Now read me something.

Dialogue: Of course.

Dialogue: Well, sure. I'll try to remember. Shoot.

Dialogue: It's just... did he... what happened in the basement?

Dialogue: I know, but...

Dialogue: Is there a point to any of this?

Dialogue: Whatever happened, it wasn't our fault. You know we couldn't have stopped it.

Dialogue: Look, Kayleigh. This may sound like bullshit coming from a guy who hasn't spoken to you in seven years...

Dialogue: But you were seven years old and there's nothing you could've done to deserve...

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Just shut up, Evan. You're wasting your breath.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: You can't hate yourself just because your dad's a twisted freak.

Dialogue: Who are you trying to convince, Evan?! You come all the way out here to stir up my shit just because you had a bad memory!? You want me to cry on your shoulder and tell you that everything's all better now? Well fuck you, Evan! Nothing's gonna be all better! Okay?! Nothing ever gets better!

Dialogue: If I was so wonderful, Evan, why didn't you ever call me? Why'd you leave me here to rot?!

Dialogue: What time is it?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Wrong answer, fuckbag. This is the very moment of your reckoning. In the next thirty seconds you're going to open one of two doors. The first door will forever traumatize your own flesh and blood.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: It'll change your daughter from a beautiful child into an empty shell whose only concept of trust was betrayed by her own sick pedophile father. Ultimately, it'll lead to her suicide. Nice work, daddy.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Let's just say you're being closely watched, George. Your other option is to get your porn off the rack and treat Kayleigh like... oh, let's say like how a loving father treats his daughter. Sound okay to you, Papa?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Listen close then, fuckbag. You screw up again and I swear I'll flat out castrate you.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: One last thing.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Don't you ever touch me again.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: I'm cold. And I'm putting on my clothes.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: What you need to do is discipline your son Tommy, because the kid's one sadistic pup.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Oh my God, Evan. You're bleeding! Look at you!

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Incredible.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Mmmm... You give good compliment. Clean up and come back to bed.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Where... where are my clothes?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Those are your clothes, silly.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: This is too amazing! Un-fucking-real!

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Whoops. Sorry. My bad.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Hey, you were with those assholes who threw popcorn at Thumper.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: And your name is... Gwen!

Speaker: gwen
Dialogue: Seriously, Evan. Lay off the blow.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Hey, uh, don't go freaking out on me over this, but do you remember when your dad first got his video camera?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Well I remember he had one... but he, like, put it away after the first day. Why would that freak me out?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I dunno.  Just being weird.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Such a goofus. See you tonight.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Come on, Mom, be there!

Speaker: answering machine
Dialogue: Aren't home right now. You know what to do.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Hi, Mom and, uh, Chuck. Just calling to say hi and well, call me.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Thumper! What time is it, man?

Speaker: thumper
Dialogue: Whasamatter? Lost your Rolex?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Huh?

Speaker: thumper
Dialogue: Fuck off, frat boy.

Speaker: professor carter
Dialogue: Remember, everyone! Only two weeks until your science projects are due.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I still owe you an essay from last week. Is there any way I could get an extension?

Speaker: professor carter
Dialogue: And you are...?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Evan Treborn.

Speaker: professor carter
Dialogue: The answer's 'no', Mr. Treborn. Now take a seat. The exam's about to begin.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Leave me alone, asshole. I didn't lay a hand on you, okay?

Speaker: hunter
Dialogue: Evan, you're hysterical. You study for this?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: We'll find out soon enough.

Speaker: hunter
Dialogue: Me neither.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: You're kidding. Are these the answers?!

Speaker: hunter
Dialogue: Damn, Evan, on the D.L.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Thanks. Wow. Hey, I want to do something really special for Kayleigh tomorrow. If I said I needed some help from you and the brothers...

Speaker: hunter
Dialogue: I'd say blow me. Get the pledges to do it.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Oh my God, that was good. Where'd you learn all those new tricks?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: So it didn't feel... weird?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Yeah, if you call multiple orgasms weird.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Yellow.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Fuck 'em.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: What do you think it is about us that makes us so perfect? Like, looking back, whatever gave you the nerve to sneak out and visit me after I moved away?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: As if my dad could've stopped me from seeing you. What's he gonna do to me?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: You think we'll always be together?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: That is the plan, right? Hell or high water?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Just making sure.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Order, order. So all you rushes know what you've got to do for me?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Pledges, rushees, same difference. Now this is a one-time deal. You do all this for me and I'll never give you shit again. Promise.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: I don't understand, where are you taking me?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: You'll see.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: I don't know what to say. It's beautiful.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Go on. Sit down.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Why are you doing all this for me?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Simple math. When I woke up this morning and saw your smile... I knew that I wanted to spend the rest of my life with you.

Speaker: hunter
Dialogue: We been lookin' all over for you, man.

Speaker: senior brother
Dialogue: Someone trashed your car.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Did you see who did this? You see anyone?

Speaker: hunter
Dialogue: Probably them Pika fuckers.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: How could he get away with this? Right in front of the goddamn frat house!

Speaker: senior brother
Dialogue: Frat house? Hey man, would you call your "country" a "cunt"?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Don't. He's probably watching.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: It's my fault. I should have told you he was released a few weeks ago.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Might'a been nice.  Like this is gonna do any good. Maybe one of the frat guys has a gun.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Please, Evan. Don't even joke. He wouldn't hurt you. He's just trying to scare you away from me.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Yeah, right. Tell that to Crockett.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: It's not his fault, Evan. You knew how bad he had it when we were kids.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Don't give me this Oprah-book club bad upbringing shit, because you turned out fine.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: My father never laid a hand on me. It's like the prick saved it all up for Tommy.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Fine, then. We'll let campus security deal with him.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Are you okay?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: It's just... you've been acting kinda strange, you know?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Like how?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: I don't know. You seem... different. You make weird jokes. Your accents changed. You don't even walk the same.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I walk differently?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: I can't put my finger on it, but everything's a bit off. Even the dinner tonight. It was beautiful, but...

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I know I've been actin strange lately. It's just that... I don't want anything to happen to us.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Wait. Something's not right. Isn't that your jacket?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Tommy.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Leave us alone you sick fuck!

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Get this "us" shit. As if I was gonna lay a hand on my own sister. You've done nicely for yourself, Evan. Nice friends, nice life, not to mention you're fucking my sister. Not a bad piece of ass if I say so myself.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Shut up, Tommy!

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Aw, hey now, that was a compliment.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: What the hell are you doing?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: It wasn't enough that the whole world loves you, but you had to take away the last person on earth who didn't think I was a piece of shit.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: No one thinks you're a piece of shit, Tommy.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Right, Evan. I believe you just said "sick fuck."

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Evan, stop! You're gonna kill him!

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: He's a fucking maniac!

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: He ruined Lenny's life --

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: He killed Crockett --  And he's trying to kill me, Kayleigh! He's trying to fucking kill me!

Speaker: carlos
Dialogue: First time?

Speaker: carlos
Dialogue: Best not bitch up. Wind up someone's luggage that way.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Can you protect me?

Speaker: carlos
Dialogue: Jesus himself couldn't make me take on the Brotherhood. When they come, just put your mind in another place, man. Be somewhere else.

Speaker: andrea
Dialogue: ...I spoke to your new lawyer about the appeal. He's sure he can get you off on self-defense, so if you're patient.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: How long will I be in here?

Speaker: andrea
Dialogue: I don't know. These things take time.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: How's Kayleigh doing? She all right?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: What about my journals, Mom? Did you bring the ones I asked for?

Speaker: andrea
Dialogue: I found these. The others are still in storage.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Damn it, Mom. I told you I need them all!

Speaker: andrea
Dialogue: Fine. You'll get them, Evan. But I think it's far more important to focus on your case right now.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Sure, Mom. You're right. Just try to tell Kayleigh I'm sorry.

Speaker: andrea
Dialogue: I'm not gonna lose you, kiddo. Promise me you'll hang on, Ev.

Speaker: karl
Dialogue: Shit on my dick or blood on my knife.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Let go! They're mine!

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Motherfucker!

Speaker: karl
Dialogue: We'll be comin' for you tonight, sister.

Speaker: karl
Dialogue: Today I found my grandfather's death certificate. He died in a nut house, just like my father. Mom denies it, but she thinks I'm gonna end up the same way...

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: You're religious Carlos, you believe that bit about "the Lord works in mysterious ways?"

Speaker: carlos
Dialogue: Straight up.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Because I think he sent me to your cell on purpose. For you to help me.

Speaker: carlos
Dialogue: Shit. I knew you were crazy.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I ain't bullshitting. Jesus speaks to me in my dreams.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Pack of smokes says I can prove it to you.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: So when I'm out, I need you to watch my face and hands closely.

Speaker: carlos
Dialogue: You need to see the prison shrink, man.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Anything today?

Speaker: convict
Dialogue: Yep. Just not for you.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Just tell me if anything weird happens.

Speaker: carlos
Dialogue: Weirder than this?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Marks, scars, I dunno. Anything could happen I guess.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Oh, Mrs. Boswelllllllll?

Speaker: carlos
Dialogue: Oh sweet Jesus. It's true. It's a miracle! A miracle!

Speaker: carlos
Dialogue: Your hands. The stigmata!

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: What did you see? What did it look like?

Speaker: carlos
Dialogue: Signs of the Lord. They just appeared out of nowhere. I thought you were loco!

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: So you believe me?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I want to make a deal.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Look. I'm new to all this but I think I get how things work. You gotta join a gang or else end up dead meat.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Well it sure ain't gonna fucking be with no niggers or spics. So how do we do this? You gotta work your way up, and I'm the new guy.  So... should I... I mean, do I suck your dicks right now?

Speaker: karl
Dialogue: Is your blood pure?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I ain't no fucking kike if that's what you mean.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Let's see what you got. And watch the fucking teeth or you'll be leaving without 'em.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Carlos!

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: We took the woods behind the junkyard just to make sure we wouldn't bump into Tommy. We hadn't seen the smoke yet.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Rot in hell you fucking animals.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Wait. Before we --

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: We need something to cut open the sack!

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I want you to take this, Lenny. Today's your day of atonement. I know how guilty you feel about that woman and her baby --

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Evan. Stop it. It's not the time.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Today you get a chance to redeem yourself. Start over with a clean slate. Tabula rasa --

Speaker: lenny
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: You're acting crazy!

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Please. If you've ever trusted me before, trust me on this one.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Cut the rope.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Listen to me good, Evan...

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I'll do whatever you want. You don't want me to ever see Kayleigh again, fine. Just let Crockett go. Besides, you kill him now and they'll stick you in juvy for sure. And I know you'd never leave your sister alone with your father.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Oh fuck, Lenny, no!

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Christ. Help me.

Speaker: thumper
Dialogue: Someone call 9-1-1!

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Okay, doc. What's the damage? How much time have I got?

Speaker: andrea
Dialogue: Cute, Evan.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Are you sure? Not even with my father?

Speaker: andrea
Dialogue: So what did you find.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Lemme guess. Would that be where the memories are stored?

Speaker: andrea
Dialogue: What does that mean for Evan?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: He's saying it's like forty years worth of new memories have been jammed in my brain since last year. Overload city. 'Sat about the gist of it, doc?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Mind if I wait in the car? The lighting here bugs my eyes.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Well, it's nice seeing you again. But you know, people to see, things to read...

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Is there anything you need? Anything I can get you?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: What about the models, man? Bet I can get you a shitload of models up in here.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Okay, Lenny. Just wanted to say "hi".

Speaker: lenny
Dialogue: You knew the whole time, didn't you?  When you put the blade in my hand, you knew something big was going to happen. Didn't you?!

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Y... yes. I guess I did.

Speaker: lenny
Dialogue: Then you should be where I am. You should be where I am.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Today I get to meet my father. His name is Jason and he is crazy...

Speaker: jason
Dialogue: Are you okay? You looked like you were somewhere else for a second there.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Look, Jason, I need some fast answers if I'm ever gonna fix what I've done.

Speaker: jason
Dialogue: I was praying this curse would have ended with me.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: But it didn't. And now I need info to make things right again and you're the only one who can give it to me.

Speaker: jason
Dialogue: There is no "right". When you change who people are, you destroy who they were.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Who's to say you can't make things better?

Speaker: jason
Dialogue: You can't play God, son. It must end with me. Just by being here, you may be killing your mother.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Bullshit. I'll send you a postcard when I've made everything perfect again.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Just get out, didja?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Huh?

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Nothing. Just that my brother did a stint in the pen and he used to eat like that.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I come from a big family.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Meant no offense.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: None taken. Hey, uh, does Kayleigh Miller still work here?

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Sorry. Never heard of her.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Good guess, fuckbag.  Remember me now? We had a great chat once when I was seven.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: One question, fuckbag. Where can I find your daughter?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Oh, I thought you were my eight o'clock. Make it fast, I'm expecting someone.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Nice to see you, too. Can I come in?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: If I knew you were coming I'd have cleaned the stains off the sheets.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: What do you want?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I just needed to see... a friendly face.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Well, time is money, Evan. So you...

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Well, I guess I can spare ten minutes for an old friend, right?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: So how's tricks? Sorry, occupational humor.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I get it. You can drop it now.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Oh, I'm sorry. Does my line of work make you uncomfortable, precious?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: No. Just that you need to hurt me with it. I've been where you've been.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Ha! Where's that?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: The bottom. When you're just a piece of meat waiting for the next attack.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: What's happened to you?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: You wouldn't believe me. I mean, people always say, "You wouldn't believe me", but in this case, it's not even worth trying.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: I've seen some sickening shit. I don't blink twice anymore, especially in your case.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Why's that?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Because you're... different.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Different? How?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Let me ask you a question. Just a little one that's been gnawing at me for years.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Yeah?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: On the bridge. How did you know that Tommy had your dog? That was no fucking hunch.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Do you remember when I was a kid and I had those blackouts?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: You're right, Evan, I don't believe you.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I never thought you would. That's why I've never bothered to tell a soul until now, and why I never will again.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: I'm the only person you've told? That's a great line. Does that make other girls swoon? Do they actually eat up this bullshit?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I couldn't give a shit if you believe me or not, and frankly I'm too tired to prove it to you.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Oh? There's proof now?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Shit. I dunno. How would I know about the twin moles on your inner thigh?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Anyone with fifty bucks could tell you that.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Then forget that. How about... you prefer the smell of a skunk to flowers, you hate cilantro because for reasons unknown to you, it reminds you of your step-sister.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Oh! And when you orgasm, your toes go numb. I'm sure your clientele aren't privy to that one.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I just thought you should know.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Know what?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: That I didn't leave you there to rot.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: There's one major hole in your story.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Which is?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: There is no fuckin' way on this planet or any other that I was in some fuckin' sorority.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Sure you don't want your wallet?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Don't think I'll need it where I'm going.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Off to change everyone's life again, is that it? Maybe this time you'll pop up in some mansion while I wind up in Tijuana doing the donkey act.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I'm over it. Whenever I try to help anyone it all turns to shit.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Well, don't give up now, Slick. You've already done so much for me. Hell, why don't you go back in time and save Mrs. Halpern and her baby. Then maybe Lenny wouldn't freak out and ruin my family.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Oh, here's one! Go back when I'm seven and fuck me in front of Daddy's handicam, you know, straighten me out a bit...

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Get out. Both of you.

Speaker: thumper
Dialogue: Sorry, dude. Just figured it'd be okay with you bein' sick and all.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I'm not saying it again.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Lord give me the strength and guidance I need to set things right.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Lady, stay back! Don't go near the mailbox!

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I mean it, woman! Get the hell back!

Speaker: lenny
Dialogue: There's a bomb in the mailbox. Get away!

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: I'll save you lady!

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I thought I told you two to beat it.

Speaker: lenny
Dialogue: What? Hey, sorry, man. We wake you up?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: No, it's cool.  Really cool.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Where are we going?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: We have to get you to Sunnyvale. You're having one of your famous hemorrhages.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Stop! Take me back!

Speaker: lenny
Dialogue: Sorry, tough guy, no can do. Your mother would kill me.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Take me back, Lenny!  You owe me that much.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: What are you geeks looking at? Must be nice to be so goddamned perfect, huh? Fucking losers.

Speaker: lenny
Dialogue: 'Sup, Sheila! We missed you at the party! Don't even think I'm giving you my lab notes either! Think I like getting up for "eight thirty's"?

Speaker: lenny
Dialogue: Hey, there's Tommy.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: I did what you said, man! We're pooling our student funds with Hillel House and we're going to have an Awareness Dance.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Oh goody, nothing like spinning my chair around to a techno mix of Hava Nagila til I puke.

Speaker: lenny
Dialogue: Uh, we should be getting to class now.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Forget it. What's the point of Psych now? Tomorrow I could wake up as some dirt farmer in Bangladesh.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Let's go for a stroll.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: So Tommy's really into this Jesus kick, huh?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: You know how spiritual he's gotten ever since he saved Mrs. Halpern and Katie.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: He saved Mrs. Halpern? Please, the twisted fuck.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Is something the matter?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Yeah, I think I gotta get these fixed or something.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Kayleigh? Do you ever think about "us?" I mean, wonder if it could ever have been different between the two of us?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Sure, Evan, why not? You were the first person I really ever cared about.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I was?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: That's why when I was little I never went to live with my mother.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I don't get it.

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: When my folks split, they gave me and Tommy a choice who we wanted to live with. I couldn't stand my dad, but I knew if I moved to my mom's I'd never see you again.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I never knew that. So then you still sometimes think of us... together?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: It's crossed my mind from time to time.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: And...?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Well a lot of things cross my mind. I've always been a fast thinker, Ev. I can play out the movie of our entire lives in under a second. Boom -- we fall in love -- get married -- two kids, your keen analytical insight matched to my generous nature -- kids grow old as do we, relatively stable relationships, matching burial plots, the whole bit. It took a lot longer to spit out than to imagine.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Then you think it might have worked out?

Speaker: kayleigh
Dialogue: Why not? But that's not how things wound up. I'm with Lenny, Lenny's your friend. And there it ends.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Would it make any difference if I told you that no one could possibly love anyone as much as I love you?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: You forgot to put the toaster on the edge.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: But you, Kayleigh and Lenny like toast. And that's really all that matters now.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: I'll get you changed. Visiting hours are almost up.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: What, did mom get transferred again?

Speaker: andrea
Dialogue: Looking. Good. Kiddo.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Lung cancer?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Sorry, Mrs. T. He's been out of sorts lately.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Right... You started chain smoking after I blew myself up.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: There must be a way to fix this.

Speaker: andrea
Dialogue: Fix?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I just need the entry about the blockbuster. Wait, shit, no arms. I never even got the chance to write it.

Speaker: andrea
Dialogue: Is Evan... different?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: He's just going through some tough times.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Mom. Don't cry. I can change this.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: I think I'll go check out the chapel.

Speaker: andrea
Dialogue: You're. Acting. Like your father.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Come on, Mom. Just 'cause Dad was my age when he started going crazy doesn't mean that I'm nuts.

Speaker: andrea
Dialogue: How. Did you. Know that?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: You told me that on Parents' Weekend. Remember? Wait, that wasn't me. Or you.

Speaker: andrea
Dialogue: Just. Like. Jason.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Don't worry. I'm gonna get you out of here.

Speaker: andrea
Dialogue: Stop him. Stop him. Stop him...

Speaker: lenny
Dialogue: Are you sure you even packed it?

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: My mom packed for me. I think she sent everything I ever owned. So we'll see.

Speaker: lenny
Dialogue: Is this it?

Speaker: lenny
Dialogue: What do you need it for? I don't get you lately.

Speaker: evan
